[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Banking Management System (BMS) defines requirements for managing banking agencies, employees, customers, and transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: BMS supports agency operations, employee management, customer accounts, and secure transactions.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: BMS integrates with financial databases, regulatory platforms, and banking records.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: BMS provides web and mobile dashboards for administrators, directors, and employees.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: BMS supports banking terminals, biometrics, and ATMs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: BMS uses PostgreSQL and REST/SOAP APIs for storage and transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: BMS secures transactions via TLS encryption and multi-factor authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Optimized for high-volume transactions and real-time updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: BMS manages agencies, employees, customer accounts, and transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Integrates with regulatory bodies, credit bureaus, and tax authorities.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: BMS handles agency management, employee records, customer accounts, and transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for administrators, directors, analysts, and auditors.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Depends on regulations, data integrity, and authentication.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with financial databases to manage customer records and transactions (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect with regulatory bodies for compliance reporting and audits (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall manage agencies, directors, employees, and customer accounts (REQ-DB-001, REQ-DB-003).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall track employee transfers between agencies and maintain an audit log (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall generate reports on financial performance, employee activity, and transaction history (REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interactive dashboard for banking transactions, compliance monitoring, and reporting.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process financial transactions with minimal delay.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store details of agencies, employees, directors, customers, and accounts.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall store regulatory compliance records, audit logs, and risk assessments.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall store transaction history, deposits, withdrawals, account balances, account types, and interest rates.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce authentication, encryption, and role-based access control mechanisms.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with banking security regulations, anti-money laundering laws, and financial audit requirements.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log account activities, transaction approvals, and compliance reports for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit and integration tests validate agency management, transactions, and employee transfers.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Financial regulations, banking security policies, and compliance standards.
